terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a provider and accessed via the internet
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to access previous versions and prevent conflicts
A unified system that stores, organizes, and provides access to all documents from a single location or platform
The use of software to automatically route documents, tasks, or processes through predefined steps without manual intervention
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes across an organization
Manufacturing Execution System - software that connects and monitors manufacturing operations on the factory floor
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies
The ability to instantly share and synchronize documents or data across multiple users simultaneously as changes are made
The automated process of directing documents through predetermined approval workflows and stakeholder review cycles
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems for compliance and accountability purposes
The process of connecting different software systems or platforms to enable seamless data exchange and workflow continuity
The conversion of physical documents and paper-based processes into digital formats for electronic storage and management
Any individual or group who has an interest in or is affected by a project, including team members, managers, and external partners
A comprehensive software environment that provides the foundation and tools for building, deploying, and managing applications or services
